API Reference¶

Application¶

class pytero.PteroApp(url: str, key: str)¶

A class/interface for interacting with the application API.

url: str

The URL of the Pterodactyl domain. This must be an absolute URL, not one that contains paths (trailing forward slash is allowed).

key: str

The API key to use for HTTP requests. This can be either an application API key or a Client API key (as of Pterodactyl v1.8).

@event¶

Returns the HTTP class event decorator for registering events to trigger on.

create_node() → None¶

TODO: Creates a new node with the given fields.

async create_server(*, name: str, user: int, egg: int, docker_image: str, startup: str, environment: dict[str, int | str | bool], limits: Limits, feature_limits: FeatureLimits, external_id: Optional[str] = None, default_allocation: Optional[int] = None, additional_allocations: Optional[list[int]] = None, deploy: Optional[DeployServerOptions] = None, skip_scripts: bool = False, oom_disabled: bool = True, start_on_completion: bool = False) → AppServer¶

Creates a new server with the given fields.

name: str

The name of the server.

user: int

The ID of the user that will own the server.

egg: int

The ID of the egg to use for the server.

docker_image: str

The docker image to use for the server.

startup: str

The startup command for the server.

environment: dict

The environment variables to set for the server.

limits: Limits

The server resource limits.

feature_limits: FeatureLimits

The server feature limits.

external_id: Optional[str]

The external identifier for the server (default is None).

default_allocation: Optional[int]

The ID of the default allocation for the server. This must be specified unless the deploy object options is set (default is None).

additional_allocations: Optional[list[int]]

A list of additional allocation IDs to be added to the server (default is None).

deploy: Optional[DeployServerOptions]

An object containing the deploy options for the server. This must be specified unless the default_allocation option is set (default is None).

skip_scripts: Optional[bool]

Whether the server should skip the egg install script during installation (default is false).

oom_disabled: Optional[bool]

Whether the OOM killer should be disabled (default is True).

start_on_completion: Optional[bool]

Whether the server should start once the installation is complete (default is False).

async create_user(*, email: str, username: str, first_name: str, last_name: str, password: Optional[str] = None, external_id: Optional[str] = None, root_admin: bool = False) → User¶

Creates a new user account with the given fields.

email: str

The email for the user.

username: str

The username for the user.

fist_name: str

The first name of the user.

last_name: str

The last name of the user.

password: Optional[str]

The password for the user (default is None).

external_id: Optional[str]

An external identifier for the user (default is None).

root_admin: Optional[bool]

Whether the user should be considered an admin (default is False).

delete_database(server: int, _id: int) → None¶

Deletes a server database by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the server database.

delete_node(_id: int, /) → None¶

Deletes a node by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the node.

delete_node_allocation(node: int, _id: int) → None¶

Deletes an allocation from a node.

node: int

The ID of the node.

id: int

The ID of the allocation.

delete_server(_id: int, *, force: bool = False) → None¶

Deletes a server by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the server.

delete_user(_id: int, /) → None¶

Deletes a user by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the user to delete.

async get_external_server(_id: str, /) → AppServer¶

Returns a server from the API with the given external identifier.

id: str

The external identifier of the server.

async get_external_user(_id: str, /) → User¶

Returns a user from the API with the given external identifier.

id: str

The external identifier of the user.

async get_node_configuration(_id: int, /) → NodeConfiguration¶

Returns the configuration of a specified node.

id: int

The ID of the node.

async get_server(_id: int, *, include: Optional[list[str]] = None) → AppServer¶

Returns a server from the API with the given ID.

include: Optional[list[str]]

A list of additional resources to include (default is None). This supports: * allocations * nest * egg * location

async get_servers(*, _filter: Optional[tuple[str, str]] = None, include: Optional[list[str]] = None, sort: Optional[str] = None) → list[pytero.servers.AppServer]¶

Returns a list of servers from the API with the given options if specified.

filter: Optional[tuple[str, str]]

A tuple containing the filter type and argument to filter by (default is None). This supports: * uuid * uuidShort * name * description * image * external_id

include: Optional[list[str]]

A list of additional resources to include (default is None). This supports: * allocations * nest * egg * location

sort: Optional[str]

The order to sort the results in (default is None). This supports: * id * uuid

async get_user(_id: int, *, include: Optional[list[str]] = None) → User¶

Returns a user from the API with the given ID.

id: int

The ID of the user.

include: Optional[list[str]]

A list of additional resources to include (default is None). This supports: * servers

async get_users(*, _filter: Optional[tuple[str, str]] = None, include: Optional[list[str]] = None, sort: Optional[str] = None) → list[pytero.users.User]¶

Returns a list of users from the API with the given options if specified.

filter: Optional[tuple[str, str]]

A tuple containing the filter type and argument to filter by (default is None). This supports: * email * uuid * username * external_id

include: Optional[list[str]]

A list of additional resources to include (default is None). This supports: * servers

sort: Optional[str]

The order to sort the results in (default is None). This supports: * id * uuid

reinstall_server(_id: int, /) → None¶

Triggers the reinstall process of a server by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the server.

async reset_database_password(server: int, _id: int) → AppDatabase¶

Resets the password for a specified database.

id: int

The ID of the server database.

suspend_server(_id: int, /) → None¶

Suspends a server by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the server.

unsuspend_server(_id: int, /) → None¶

Unsuspends a server by its ID.

id: int

The ID of the server.

update_node() → None¶

TODO: Updates a specified node with the given fields.

async update_user(_id: int, *, email: Optional[str] = None, username: Optional[str] = None, first_name: Optional[str] = None, last_name: Optional[str] = None, password: Optional[str] = None, external_id: Optional[str] = None, root_admin: bool = False) → User¶

Updates a specified user with the given fields.

id: int

The ID of the user to update.

email: Optional[str]

The email for the user (default is the current value).

username: Optional[str]

The username for the user (default is the current value).

fist_name: Optional[str]

The first name of the user (default is the current value).

last_name: Optional[str]

The last name of the user (default is the current value).

password: Optional[str]

The password for the user (default is None).

external_id: Optional[str]

An external identifier for the user (default is the current value).

root_admin: Optional[bool]

Whether the user should be considered an admin (default is the current value).

Client¶

class pytero.PteroClient(url: str, key: str)¶

A class/interface for interacting with the client API.

url: str

The URL of the Pterodactyl domain. This must be an absolute URL, not one that contains paths (trailing forward slash is allowed).

key: str

The API key to use for HTTP requests. This must be a client API key, NOT an application API key.

@event¶

A decorator shorthand function for RequestManager#event().

disable_account_two_factor(password: str, /) → None¶

Disables two-factor authentication for the user associated with the API key.

password: str

The password for the account associated with the API key.

async enable_account_two_factor(code: int, /) → list[str]¶

Enables two-factor authentication for the user associated with the API key.

code: int

The TOTP code generated with the authentication details.

async get_account() → Account¶

Returns an account object for the user associated with the API key being used.

async get_account_two_factor() → dict[str, str]¶

Returns a dict containing the two-factor authentication details.

async get_permission_keys() → dict[str, Any]¶

Returns a dict containing the permission keys, values and descriptions for the client API.

update_account_email(email: str, password: str) → None¶

Updates the email for the user account associated with the API key.

email: str

The new email for the account.

password: str

The password for the account.

update_account_password(old: str, new: str) → None¶

Updates the password for the user account associated with the API key.

old: str

The old password of the account.

new: str

The new password for the account.

Events¶

class pytero.Emitter¶

Events emitter manager for Pytero

add_event(name: str, slot: Callable[[...], None]) → None¶

Adds a callback function for a specified event. Note that the function can be synchronous or asynchronous as both will be handled when emitted.

name: str

The name of the event.

slot: Callable[…, None]

The callback function.

clear_slots() → None¶

Clears all the events and callback functions.

async emit_event(name: str, *args, **kwargs) → None¶

Emits an event callback with the given arguments.

name: str

The name of the event.

args: Any

A tuple of arguments to be passed on to the event callback.

kwargs: Any

A dict of arguments to be passed on to the event callback.

has_event(name: str, /) → bool¶

Returns True if the specified event has a callback function.

name: str

The name of the event.

remove_event(name: str, /) → None¶

Removes a callback function for a specified event.

name: str

The name of the event.

HTTP¶

class pytero.RequestManager(api: str, url: str, key: str)¶

Errors¶

Error definitions for Pytero.

exception pytero.errors.AccessError(cls)¶

Raised when a resource cannot/should not be accessed yet

exception pytero.errors.EventError¶

Raised when there is an error with an event

exception pytero.errors.PteroAPIError(message: str, data: dict[str, list[dict[str, str]]])¶

The error object received from Pterodactyl when there is an error

exception pytero.errors.RangeError¶

Errors received for invalid ranges

exception pytero.errors.RequestError¶

Errors received upon requesting a Pterodactyl endpoint

exception pytero.errors.ShardError¶

Raised when a shard authentication or connection fails

exception pytero.errors.ValidationError¶

Errors received when a request validation fails

Types¶

class pytero.Node(http, data: dict[str, Any])¶

Account and user definitions for user objects in the Pterodactyl API.

class pytero.users.Account(http, data: dict[str, Any])¶

Represents an account object in the client API.

General data, enum and typing classes for Pytero.

class pytero.types.FeatureLimits(allocations: int, backups: int, databases: int)¶
class pytero.types.Limits(memory: int, disk: int, swap: int, io: int, cpu: int, threads: Optional[str], oom_disabled: Optional[bool])¶
class pytero.types.Location(id: int, long: str, short: str, created_at: str, updated_at: str | None)¶
class pytero.types.Nest(id: int, uuid: str, author: str, name: str, description: str, created_at: str, updated_at: str | None)¶
class pytero.types.NetworkAllocation(id: int, ip: str, ip_alias: str | None, port: int, notes: str | None, is_default: bool)¶
class pytero.types.NodeConfiguration(debug: bool, uuid: str, token_id: str, token: str, api: dict[str, int | str | dict[str, str | bool]], system: dict[str, str | dict[str, int]], allowed_mounts: list[str], remote: str)¶
class pytero.types.Resources(memory_bytes: int, cpu_absolute: int, disk_bytes: int, network_rx_bytes: int, network_tx_bytes: int, uptime: int)¶
class pytero.types.SSHKey(name: str, fingerprint: str, public_key: str, created_at: str)¶
class pytero.types.Statistics(current_state: str, is_suspended: bool, resources: pytero.types.Resources)¶
class pytero.types.Task(id: int, sequence_id: int, action: str, payload: str, time_offset: int, is_queued: bool, continue_on_failure: bool, created_at: str, updated_at: str | None)¶
class pytero.types.WebSocketAuth(socket: str, token: str)¶
class pytero.types.WebSocketEvent(event: str, args: list[str] | None)¶

Permissions¶

Permissions definitions for the Pterodactyl API.

class pytero.permissions.Flags(value)¶

An enum class containing all the permission keys for the API.

class pytero.permissions.Permissions(*perms: str | pytero.permissions.Flags)¶

The base class for managing permissions with the API.

all(*perms: str | pytero.permissions.Flags) → bool¶

Returns True is all of the specified permissions exist in the permission instance.

perms: tuple[str | Flags]

A tuple of strings or permission flags.

any(*perms: str | pytero.permissions.Flags) → bool¶

Returns True if any of the specified permissions exist in the permission instance.

perms: tuple[str | Flags]

A tuple of strings or permission flags.

is_admin() → bool¶

Returns True if any of the permissions in the instance are administrative.

static resolve(*perms: str | pytero.permissions.Flags) → list[str]¶

Resolves the given permissions into a list of valid API permissions.

perms: tuple[str | Flags]

A tuple of strings or permission flags.

serialize() → dict[str, bool]¶

Returns a dict of permission keys mapping to their presence in the permission instance.

Utilities¶

Utility functions for Pytero.

pytero.util.transform(data: object, *, ignore: Optional[list[str]] = None, cast: Optional[dict[str, Callable[..., Any]]] = None, maps: Optional[dict[str, str]] = None) → dict[str, Any]¶

Transforms an object into its JSON object form.
